title: Monsoon Alert - Rain warning for two days in several states including Kerala and Tamil Nadu - Times Bull
article_text:
New Delhi – Temperatures are dropping these days, from the plains of North India to the mountains. This is increasing the intensity of the cold. Light to heavy snowfall is being recorded in various parts of Jammu and Kashmir and Himachal Pradesh. The plains may soon experience the harshest of winters.

On Tuesday, the weather will deteriorate in many areas, with rain expected. Air quality in Delhi-NCR has deteriorated significantly, with haze covering the sky, making it difficult for people to venture outside. Smoke is visible in the sky after Diwali fireworks. The Indian Meteorological Department has issued a rain warning for various regions of the country. Find out what the weather will be like for each location below.

Uttar Pradesh Weather

According to the Meteorological Department, the dry weather may lead to mild heat during the day. Minimum temperatures are expected to drop from the second day of Diwali. The IMD has predicted an increase in cold weather from October 21st to 22nd.

The IMD has predicted a light fog and cold weather in the morning. Diwali fireworks may cause pollution haze in several districts of western Uttar Pradesh, including Kanpur, Lucknow, Varanasi, Prayagraj, Agra, Noida, Ghaziabad, and Greater Noida.

Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh Weather

According to the Meteorological Department, the weather in Uttarakhand is also expected to deteriorate on October 21st. The IMD has predicted rain accompanied by thunderstorms in many areas of Uttarkashi, Bageshwar, Chamoli, Rudraprayag, and Pithoragarh. Rain and snowfall are expected due to the influence of a western disturbance.

The weather in Himachal Pradesh is expected to change on October 21st, 23rd, and 24th. Strong winds may be expected due to the western disturbance. Moderate rain and thundershowers may occur in higher altitudes. The weather is expected to deteriorate significantly in Lahaul Spiti, Kinnaur, Sirmaur, Chamba, Kangra, and Solan.

Rainfall in these states

The Meteorological Department has predicted rainfall in many areas of Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, and Kerala. Rain warnings have been issued for parts of Maharashtra, Goa, Andhra Pradesh, and Telangana. The weather is also expected to deteriorate significantly in the northeastern states.

Rainfall is expected in Manipur, Arunachal Pradesh, and Puducherry. There may be scattered rainfall in Mizoram, Tripura, and Sikkim. Caution is advised due to the possibility of lightning.

title: IMD issues yellow alert for 11 Kerala districts; heavy rain likely till October 26 - Onmanorama
article_text:
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Tuesday issued a yellow alert for 11 districts in Kerala, Pathanamthitta, Alappuzha, Kottayam, Ernakulam, Idukki, Thrissur, Palakkad, Malappuram, Kozhikode and Wayanad. Additionally, an orange alert has been issued for Pathanamthitta, Alappuzha, Kottayam, Ernakulam and Idukki for Wednesday. The rest of the districts will remain under yellow alert.

According to the weather agency, a well-marked low-pressure area over the southeast Arabian Sea is likely to intensify into a depression while moving westwards during the next 24 hours. Another low-pressure area is also likely to form over the southeast Bay of Bengal within the same period. It is expected to move west-northwestwards and intensify further into a depression over the central parts of the south Bay of Bengal and adjoining west-central Bay of Bengal over the subsequent 48 hours.

The upper air cyclonic circulation over south Kerala and adjoining Comorin area now lies over the southeast Arabian Sea off the Kerala coast and extends up to 1.5 km above mean sea level. A trough runs from this cyclonic circulation to the south Andaman Sea, across the southeast Arabian Sea, at about 0.9 km above mean sea level.

IMD alert. Image: Canva

Under the influence of these systems, widespread rainfall activity with heavy (7–11 cm in 24 hours) to very heavy rainfall (12–20 cm in 24 hours) is very likely at one or two places in Kerala between October 22 and 24. Heavy rainfall is also likely at isolated places on October 21, 25, and 26, and over Lakshadweep between October 20 and 22.

ADVERTISEMENT

Districts under orange alert:

October 22: Pathanamthitta, Alappuzha, Kottayam, Ernakulam and Idukki

October 23: Kozhikode, Wayanad

October 24: Kannur and Kasaragod

Districts under yellow alert:

October 21: Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta, Alappuzha, Kottayam, Ernakulam, Idukki, Thrissur, Palakkad, Malappuram, Kozhikode and Wayanad

October 22: Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Thrissur, Palakkad, Malappuram, Kozhikode, Wayanad, Kannur Kasaragod

October 23: Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta, Kottayam, Malappuram, Kannur and Kasaragod

ADVERTISEMENT

Probable impacts due to heavy rain

The IMD has warned of several possible impacts due to the heavy to very heavy rainfall expected in the coming days. Poor visibility and traffic congestion are likely during intense spells of rain, along with waterlogging, uprooting of trees, and damage to power lines. Kutcha houses and other vulnerable structures may also suffer damage, while flash floods, landslides, and flooding in low-lying areas are possible. Surface and helicopter transport could be disrupted, and heavy rainfall may harm standing crops and vegetables, causing soil erosion. There is also a risk of lightning injuries to people and cattle in open areas.

Authorities have advised the public to follow traffic advisories and avoid waterlogged or landslide-prone regions. People are urged to stay away from vulnerable structures and riverfronts. Farmers have been asked to provide mulch at the base of crops and avoid working in the fields during thunderstorms. Tourism and recreational activities are expected to be regulated, and sowing of seeds should be postponed to prevent water stagnation. The IMD has also urged residents to stay updated with official weather alerts.

title: बड़ी खबर(देहरादून) इन जनपदों में पश्चिमी विक्षोभ का होगा असर. वर्षा और हिमपात से बढ़ेगी ठंड । - Uttarakhand City News
article_text:
Uttarakhand city news dehradun उत्तराखंड में 20 अक्टूबर को दीपावली निपट ने के बाद राज्य में एक बार फिर मौसम करवट लगा इसके बाद समूची राज्य में कड़ाके की ठंड पड़ने की संभावना मौसम विभाग ने जताई है।मौसम विभाग का कहना है कि मंगलवार को मौसम साफ रहने के बाद 22 अक्टूबर को उत्तरकाशी, चमोली, पिथौरागढ़, बागेश्वर और रुद्रप्रयाग जिले में हल्की बारिश के साथ ऊंचाई वाले इलाकों में बर्फबारी हो सकती है। मौसम वैज्ञानिकों के अनुसार ला लीना के प्रभाव से इस बार सर्दी जल्दी शुरू हो रही है।
23 से 25 अक्टूबर उत्तर प्रदेश में मौसम साफ रहने की संभावना है। उत्तराखंड से मॉनसून की विदाई होने के बाद से लगातार तेज धूप खिलने और मौसम शुष्क होने की वजह से दिन के समय गर्मी हो रही है जबकि सुबह और शाम के समय हल्की ठंड पड़ रही है।
हालांकि से एक-दो दिनों से दिन में सूरज की तपिश ज्यादा महसूस हो रही है। दिन और रात के समय तापमान में बढ़ते अंतर के कारण बच्चों और बुजुर्गों को स्वास्थ्य संबंधी समस्याएं भी हो रही है।
मौसम वैज्ञानिक रोहित थपलियाल के अनुसार प्रदेश से मॉनसून की भले ही पूरी तरह से विदाई हो गई हो लेकिन ला लीना का प्रभाव इस बार ठंड को जल्दी लाएगा और ज्यादा सर्दी सताएगी। प्रदेश के कई इलाकों में शीत लहर चलेगी और ऊंचाई वाले इलाकों में अच्छी बर्फबारी भी हो सकती है।
